Reviews.Title: The second one I have purchased
Reviews.Author: blueocean*
Reviews.Content: My first one I had on my deployment-I still have it. And it still works, even though I dropped it an it was run over by a HMMV! I freaked but picked it up, brushed it off and was back to shooting pics with it. No damage. Now that is TOUGH. I bought this one because I liked the color and the updates. Pics always are clear- and no, I am not a professional in any sense. I own a Canon, a Nikon, a few disposable cameras and now 2 Olympus TOUGH cameras. I never take my Canon or Nikon traveling- too expensive to replace. The TOUGH cameras go with me EVERYWHERE. I know I can rely on their toughness, and can take it hiking, climbing, boating, camping, running- and I love the obstacle courses so we are not just talking flat roads here. I can take it into the deserts and not worry about heat with this. Into the snowy mountains snowshoes and it doesn't freeze. (I do keep it next to my body, inside my coat. But, no matter where I take this, I always get good pictures-many of which I get compliments on, and I can always count on it being able to withstand whatever trials I put myself through. I will keep buying these cameras as long as they make them.

Reviews.Title: Takes pictures underwater
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth D.
Reviews.Content: I like that it takes pictures underwater, which is totally awesome, but it makes bad choices with white balance and contrast and such. I realize that there are many settings, but none of them does a particularly good job. I also haven't figured out how to control the shutter speed except putting it on sports mode which puts it at 1/500, which is faster that what I normally need, but on other settings, it decides for me, and picks for instance 1/30, which is too slow for moving people. I need a happy medium, like 1/100. There is also a slight delay between the time I push the shutter button and when it takes the pictures. I'm used to my Canon DSLR, so I guess I'm a little spoiled. On the other hand, it's supposedly more rugged, so I have been letting my kid at take pictures at the zoo and such with it without worrying about it dropping or something.

Reviews.Title: Great product, great price, love the GPS feature, 16MP and HD video
Reviews.Author: K. Ling-Torres "Jewelry lover"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera other than being little bit too big everything is great.  The reason why I got this is for our snorkeling tour but ended up didn't go.  It has GPS feature, 16MP and HD video.  The resolution and sharpness of the pictures are great.  Most of the pictures turn out really nice.  You can pay about $100 less for TG-820 model for around $150.00 but I think it is worth the money.  I ended up climbing the waterfalls in Jamaica and the camera accidentally dipped into the water by mistake but nothing happen.  This camera can go under water 33 feet. This is also shock, crush & freeze proof but I didn't do any of those test.  It says 5x zoom but I had one video shot up to 10x, I was shock.  During my research, I couldn't find any where say that what is the size of the memory card.  It is the SD card not micro SD.  My camera vendor recommends this camera to me.  I really love it.I also purchased matching color red case Tamrac 3814, Olympus foam float strap, tripod and Sony 32GB SDHC/SDXC Class 10 UHS-1 R40 Memory Card.  I am really happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Camera works great
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: Wife loves it, she can't wait to take it out to the beach. Also wants to try it out the next time we go kayaking.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Sayward
Reviews.Content: I have always bought Olympus cameras and so far this one is out doing all the others. It takes fast pics which is great with the kids and they are great quality.  It also takes good video. I have not taken it to the water yet.

Reviews.Title: Poor at best
Reviews.Author: Seemore
Reviews.Content: I must say I have owned on of these before. It worked well till it took on water. I decided it could be user error and purchased a newer version. I have used ( not even myself ) to charge and verify it worked. It has not since, and it has been registered. Amazon determined it was not returnable, but it was purchased as a Christmas gift. Purchased on Sept. 27, and dead before Christmas eve. The manufacturer stated they would sent a new battery which they haven't.I can tell you my disappointment in both Amazon, as well as, Olympus! I am going to swim with sharks tomorrow with no camera. I will seriously consider never doing business in the future.Todd

Reviews.Title: Poor Picture Quality; Noisy Video
Reviews.Author: C. Emptor
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible camera unless you are going to use it for a gift for a third grader or exclusively for social media posts where image quality isn't a factor.The specs and features are impressive, but the camera fails at its core purpose: Photograpy.The images are ok when viewed small, but if you expand to 100 percent you will find they consist of a very pixelated pattern.  Sort of like seeing a mosaic up close.  This effect is not subtle, and renders the images much worse than, say, a point and shoot from 1999.  The panorama mode is even worse.  Fuzzy.The video is a complete waste of time.  You are far better off just using an iPhone or other phone cam video.  Here's why:  The video is fuzzy, and the audio picks up some sort of in-camera adjustment, which sounds a little like far-away automatic weapons fire.  Maybe 600 rounds per minute or so.  The volume is very close to a person speaking n the video, for example.  The burst lasts for about 1 or 2 seconds each time, and it pretty much ruins the video if you want to hear sound for.The camera would be ok for a child or clumsy person who drops it a lot.If you buy this from Amazon, be sure to give it a good check during the return period.  I delayed too long and now I'm stuck with a ~$230 lesson in not being lazy about checking this out doing the review period.  I may be sounding harsh, but the problems with this camera are identical to other Olympus stylus tough camera reviews.  (I did not notice the same complaints about this camera; it had some good reviews on other sites; I thought it was safe.  it is not safe.  They are using the same technology in several models, and it is a genetic defect in the entire family line, not an isolated mutation.Edit:Seeing I am one of only 4 people with a dismal review, I'm wondering if there may be a quality control problem that makes some of these cameras bad?  Either there are a lot of people who are OK with fuzzy video and photos and a noise in the video, or it's not happening for everybody.

Reviews.Title: A Great Durable Camera!
Reviews.Author: EDay
Reviews.Content: Took this on a cruise and took some great pictures. Very easy to learn to use.  Have not tried underwater yet but will this summer. Bought it because my son has an older version and has loved it.

Reviews.Title: Not good for videos
Reviews.Author: Louise L.C.
Reviews.Content: I can't give this camera a good rating because it makes a clicking sound when you playback videos.  If you listen you can hear the sound inside the camera when it is recording. It must be located right next to the mic because it is amplified on playback.

Reviews.Title: Needs improvement
Reviews.Author: CTLisa
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures but the buttons are too close together and I end up turning the camera off instead of snapping a picture. The settings dial moves too easily and I frequently found it in the wrong position.

Reviews.Title: VERY easy to figure out!
Reviews.Author: fastforward194
Reviews.Content: Three days after this camera was delivered, I left for Denmark to be with my grandchildren for a month .  I skimmed through the User's Manual once and didn't have to refer to it again.  Almost all still photos taken in Auto Mode were in focus and colors were true.  I experimented with the pre-programed scene settings and found 3 or 4 of these settings drastically improved the quality of photos taken in each specific, difficult situation.  I used the indoor/night setting a lot!  After I got home I discovered a setting for close-up portrait shots that allows you to enhance in ways similar to more complicated digital editing done on the PC.  The camera will make wrinkles vanish and enhance facial features!!!  Adding all of these great qualities to the fact this Olympus GT-830 is small, easy to use, waterproof, and rugged, I'm glad I spent the extra money for a camera that helps me to record life's special moments so beautifully.  Hey, it even has a GPS!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Deb
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use.  I plan to take it on a scuba diving trip.  I also purchased the underwater housing but I haven't yet tried out the housing underwater.  I like the fact that the camera without an underwater housing can get wet and if using the camera poolside no housing is needed.

Reviews.Title: bought as a gift
Reviews.Author: Michael W. Armistead
Reviews.Content: This is the camera my long distance runner son requested.  It will take great pictures and can stand up to the rough terrain he may choose.  He had researched the camera and was delighted on Christmas morning.

Reviews.Title: Works well and takes good pictures
Reviews.Author: jmyersdad
Reviews.Content: This camera is probably as good as it gets for ones this size in this price range for this kind of durability. I did some research before purchasing, and this Stylus was recommended.In "auto" mode I feel the pictures can get a bit grainy or the edges of things gets that weird, hard-outline effect instead of a gradual transition. However, I found these happen because the camera is setting the ISO and aperture and other things for what it thinks is best for the setting. Thus it ends up compromising quality for simplicity.In order to get the best you can out of this camera, you will have to do a little reading to understand how to set various aspects of it yourself to best fit the environment, in my opinion. The lower the ISO, the less the grainy-ness and the better the sharpness. So on auto perhaps not the best out there, but I've owned many point-and-shoot cameras, and none of them have had what I'd call "great" performance on auto from a more refined point of view. This is perhaps as good as it gets.As for the durability: My son took this camera with him to Africa this summer, and he captured very adequate pictures for the most part--on "auto." We were pleased with its performance and durability; all the bumpy roads it endured and hard dirt it was dropped on didn't phase it in the least. It came back in the same shape it left. I would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: like it
Reviews.Author: T. Laszlo "Buckeye Book Reader"
Reviews.Content: I like it.  Haven't used it much yet.  Hoping it truly is water proof.  Was not a speedy delivery but came in a timely fashion.

Reviews.Title: Camera fits the bill to a tea.
Reviews.Author: Harry Wilkins, Jr.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a birthday gift for my wife and it had all the features that she felt were important to her. It arrived just in time for her birthday. he has enjoyed using it as she learns more about the camera. We are now an all Olympus camera family.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus TG-830 - big disappointment
Reviews.Author: greg
Reviews.Content: The camera looks good and has a lot of interesting options. Unfortunately it fails with the most fundamental task - taking pictures.It's really very disappointing but the picture quality is simply very bad. I tried different settings but no change. Colors are pale, lighting looks strange and noise reduction is absolutely out of any proportion.Out of 100 photos, maybe 5-8 were up to acceptable standard. Actually, my cell phone camera takes much better pictures. So, my sincere advice, if you consider this camera, just don't risk big disappointment - get something else.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Erika Lacerda Brasi­lia Brasil
Reviews.Content: Bad bad image quality. Completely grainy, even under sunshine. Waste of money.Yes, it does have some cool tools, but what's te point if the image is poor?Very disapointed.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera with great results so far.
Reviews.Author: James E Vadas
Reviews.Content: Have not tested its underwater capabilities yet but had it at the beach in the sand and weather and has done great.  Taking it out in the forests and fields in pocket or backpack is great too although I plan to get a light inexpensive camera case just to keep it from getting scratched up.

Reviews.Title: does way  to much
Reviews.Author: Michael Caggiano
Reviews.Content: H have an olympus PHD (push here dummy) camera and love it. When I bought this camera I thought it was similar but this camera does so many things I am confused with working it  I am NOT an avid camera buff but I am not stupid either but this camera is very confusing. I have my daughter comming over tomorrow to try to change the date and time

Reviews.Title: Great product, fair price and quick shipment.
Reviews.Author: M Discher
Reviews.Content: This is a Christmas gift so it remains unused (as yet).  I have had GREAT service from my previous Olympus which I obtained prior to going to Iraq in 2008, and it's still in use.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: This item met my expectations and I have no complaints about it whatsoever. However, I have not tried the underwater mode yet. I highly recommend this item.

Reviews.Title: Issues with streaking on photos from sun
Reviews.Author: JJonthego
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to get this camera but I'm having a lot of problems with the sun causing streaks across photos. Also, when there is bright sun in the background it tends to wash out the sky. Not sure if there is a way to fix this. I am guessing it has something to do with the chrome bezel and the lens not being very recessed.I'm hoping I can find a solution otherwise I will be reselling this and looking for a different camera.Other than that issue it's been really good. Underwater pics turn out well and the camera feels extremely rugged. A bit bulky, but that's expected from a rugged camera.Any suggestions?

Reviews.Title: Bad Photos and no waterproof.
Reviews.Author: Boris
Reviews.Content: The photos are not good because the lens are too small.You need much light for a good photo.No good definition in the photo. Much noise.The camera is very very heavy for a compact camera.If you use under the water. Some of water is introduced inside the camera. Only with 1 ft of water. And after that, the lens fogs, and you cant keep taking photos.Bad bad.The panoramic function are a s*** in this camera.The LCD screen are too dark. When you take a picture outside, with sun, you can't see the image in the LCD screen.In general, is not a good camera.The unique great feature are the GPS feature. But if you want a camera waterproof or with gps, you must buy another, because this are not a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Ok camera
Reviews.Author: Kahmissa steenhausen
Reviews.Content: This camera is not very responsive and takes ok pics.  It was a consumer report best buy and I would buy another camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera rating
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: It is going on its first vacation in hours so will see but so far it has taken nice pictures.

Reviews.Title: Broken camera
Reviews.Author: Jay Stewart
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed to receive a completely worthless camera .  It did not work at all straight out of the box.  Can you please advise me on how I can retrieve my money from this company?
